text.name: console_notes
text.text: The Nintendo 64DD (ウ ン テ ン ド ウ 64DD, Nintendō Roku Jū Yon DD) ("DD" being short for "Disk drive" and originally "Dynamic Drive") was a peripheral to the Nintendo 64 console. It was plugged into the N64 through the EXTension Port that It was located on the underside of the console and allowed the N64 to use proprietary 64 MB capacity magnetic disks to increase data storage capacity. Although it was announced before the release of N64, 64DD development was slow. It was a commercial flaw and was never released in either the US or Europe.
